programmes.show_description: (2005) Gael Garcia Bernal plays an ex-navy rating who infiltrates pastor William Hurt's family to exact revenge for a wrong suffered by his mother. Sex/violence/strong language from start.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
...Abigail Gorman: Abigail is a well-known activist and campaigner. We follow her through an ADHD diagnosis and ask her what the future might hold.
Teleshopping.
(1951) Korean War drama about the stress of battle. Officers drop one by one as a US platoon fights a rearguard action, leaving one unwilling man (Richard Basehart) to take their place.
(1968) Epic Second World War drama starring Robert Mitchum. A reporter gets trapped behind enemy lines during the costly 1944 Allied invasion of Italy. With Peter Falk and Robert Ryan.
(1957) Western starring Randolph Scott and John Carroll. A man seeking revenge for his wife's death tracks his rival down in the sleepy town of Sundown...
(1966) Western with Maureen O'Hara and James Stewart. With the help of a drifter, a widow strives to fulfil her husband's last wish to introduce rare cattle to the perilous American west.
(2019) Adventure comedy sequel with Dwayne Johnson, Jack Black, Kevin Hart and Karen Gillan. The old school pals enter the Jumanji video game again to save their friend.
(2023) Eva Longoria directs the real-life story of Richard Montañez - the Latino janitor who invented Flamin' Hot Cheetos, aka the 'world's most popular snack'. Starring Jesse Garcia.
(2022) Fact-based drama with Elizabeth Banks and Sigourney Weaver. An underground abortion network helps a woman with a life-threatening pregnancy in pre-Roe-v-Wade America.
(2021) Poignant sci-fi romantic comedy with Maren Eggert and Dan Stevens. In near-future Berlin, a lonely archaeologist helps to trial a new line in robot companions. In German/subs.
Teleshopping.
Teleshopping.
(1943) Second World War drama starring Tyrone Power and Anne Baxter. An ambitious naval officer falls in love with a school teacher before leaving on a dangerous submarine mission.
(1949) World War II drama starring Gregory Peck as a US general who must treat a demoralised bomber squadron severely to restore discipline. With Oscar-winning support from Dean Jagger.
Director Quentin Tarantino and stars Samuel L Jackson, Christoph Waltz, Jamie Foxx and Kerry Washington talk about making the western adventure set against a backdrop of slavery.
(1995) Romantic drama based on Arthurian legend, starring Richard Gere, Sean Connery and Julia Ormond. Can nomadic swordsman Lancelot contain his love for King Arthur's fiancée?
...Interview Special: Stars Chris Hemsworth and Tessa Thompson, director F Gary Gray and producers Walter Parkes and Laurie Macdonald talk about bringing the series back for a fourth part.
(2019) Fourth instalment of the sci-fi comedy franchise with Chris Hemsworth, Tessa Thompson and Liam Neeson. An alien-obsessed rookie joins London's Men in Black team.
(2023) Matt Johnson, Glenn Howerton and Jay Baruchel star in the frenetic, flabbergasting and mostly true story of the precipitous rise and fall of the once ubiquitous device.
(2019) Keanu Reeves returns for the third time as the supposedly retired hitman. Someone's put a contract on John Wick's head and only a mystic in Morocco can lift it.
